title: United Way Logo Font
content:
I wanted to know the name of this font. It looks like "Officina Serif Std Bold" but there are some slight differences. Any help?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307230506im_/http:/typophile.com/files/unitedway_5571.gif)
author: guezworks

comments.content:
That looks like an altered Officina.

Nick Cooke

I know that the font they use in their materials, as well as taglines, etc is called MetaBold. The one in the logo looks like a slightly serifed version of that. It's REALLY similar to officina...

- becky
It’s rather Officina Serif and not Meta. They’re both designed by Erik Spiekermann, though. And if I may say so, the man’s known for - ehm - having a distinctive style.
Speaking of Mr. Spiekermann’s creations - Featured Face just changed to one of his, and it’s even rounded.
